Aitech will showcase its new AI-on-the-edge solution and convection-cooled supercomputer at the 17th Annual Ground Vehicle Systems Engineering & Technology Symposium (GVSETS) in Novi, Michigan from August 12-15.

articles.title: Will AI Chatbots Revolutionize Therapy as Your Next Virtual Counselor?
articles.summary: AI chatbots like ChatGPT are becoming increasingly popular with people who rely on them for emotional support. articles.title: Trump's AI Action Plan Is at War With Itself

It's made possible by Tower's charge-domain imaging platform which is leveraged by AIStorm's proprietary charge- domain-based analog AI neurons.

articles.title: Which Countries Are Investing Most in AI?
articles.author: Daniel Liberto
articles.summary: The U.S. is the biggest investor in AI, both in the private and government sectors. Private investment totaled $471 billion from 2013 through 2024, including $109 billion in 2024 alone. The Chinese private sector invested $119 billion in AI between 2013 and 2024. The government spent $5.2 billion on AI-related contracts from 2013 to 2023. The U.K. government invested $26 billion between 2013-2023.

articles.title: Staff fear UK's Turing AI Institute at risk of collapse
articles.summary: Alan Turing Institute for Artificial Intelligence is at risk of collapse, according to staff at the UK's national institute for artificial intelligence. Technology Secretary Peter Kyle threatened to withdraw its funding. Workers at the institute raised a series of "serious and escalating concerns" in a whistleblowing complaint submitted to the Charity Commission.

articles.title: OpenAI beats Grok in chess

articles.summary: OpenAI's o3 model defeated xAI's Grok 4 in a chatbot chess tournament. It's been 30 years since a machine first beat a grandmaster in a chess match. The o3's victory is a clear signal of success.

articles.title: How to lead with focus during a company-wide transformation
articles.author: Jenny Fernandez

They helped the executive team articulate a shared purpose. They identified five enterprise-wide priorities, each with a clearly defined owner and desired outcome.

articles.title: Bigbear.ai: Sell BBAI Stock At $5?
articles.author: Trefis Team
articles.summary: BigBear.ai (NYSE:BBAI) experienced a 30% decline in its stock during after-hours trading following a disappointing quarter reported on August 11. The company's sales decreased by 18% compared to the previous year, falling short of consensus expectations by over 20%. The company retracted its full-year adjusted EBITDA guidance and revised its revenue forecast downwards. The stock is trading at 7.2 times its trailing revenues, which is higher than its average price-to-sales ratio of 3.3 over the past four years. The risk of investing in BBAI stock at this juncture appears to be high.

articles.title: AI Is Forcing the Return of the In-Person Job Interview

It was developed by Axon, the law enforcement tech company that also makes tasers and body cameras. It's been its fastest-growing product since it launched last year. It has been adopted in Lafayette, Indiana; Tampa, Florida; and Fort Collins, Colorado. Some legal experts and civil rights advocates are concerned that AI-drafted police reports could contain biases or inaccuracies, as well as presenting potential transparency issues.

SoftBank is the lead investor in OpenAI's recently announced $40 billion funding round that values the ChatGPT creator at $300 billion. The proliferation of XaaS (Everything-as-a-Service) is driving a need for new service management approaches. Multi-cloud strategies require tools and processes to manage services across different cloud providers. articles.summary: Ungdall, Axeofjudgement, Fireproof and Grok are discussing Elmo's case about Apple's AI. It took me a second to remember enough context to understand the post. AxeofJudgement reported him for misogyny.

articles.title: How to measure AI bullshiat
articles.summary: Enable JavaScript for Fark in order to vote for entries. View the voting results: Smartest and Funniest here. Rev.K compares AI to Elon Musk, because it wants people to like it, so it says things that it thinks people want to hear.

articles.title: POLL! How Often Do You Use ChatGPT or Some Comparable AI Service?
articles.summary: Humboldt has a history of being averse to trends, fashion and otherwise. However, LoCO is witnessing plenty of AI creep through the Redwood Curtain these days. How often do you use ChatGPT or some comparable AI service? The poll closes on Thursday at 4:20 pm.

articles.title: Idaho Fast Food Jobs Vanish As Wages Rise And Robots Take Orders
articles.author: Kevin Miller
articles.summary: The move by California to raise the wages of fast food workers has caused many independent and corporate chains to reevaluate their workforce. Mega chains have embraced robot cooks and some chains have begun using Artificial Intelligence to replace workers. Wendy's in Idaho uses AI to take your order.
